proposals.title: Predicting Order Fulfillment
proposals.description: This AI use case focuses on predicting whether an order will be fulfilled or not based on available order attributes.  A classification model will be trained on historical sales data to identify patterns and relationships between order characteristics (like payment method, store location, product category) and order fulfillment status. This predictive capability allows for proactive intervention and resource allocation to improve fulfillment efficiency.
kpis: On-time fulfillment rate: Percentage of orders fulfilled on time as predicted by the model.
Fulfillment accuracy: Percentage of accurate predictions made by the model.
Reduction in fulfillment lead time: Average reduction in the time taken to fulfill orders.
Improved customer satisfaction scores related to order fulfillment.
proposals.business_value: By predicting potential fulfillment issues, businesses can proactively address them, leading to improved customer satisfaction, reduced operational costs, and enhanced supply chain management. This can result in increased customer loyalty and revenue.
proposals.prediction_interpretation: The model will output a probability score between 0 and 1. A score closer to 1 indicates a high likelihood of the order being fulfilled, while a score closer to 0 suggests a higher probability of it not being fulfilled. For example, a prediction of 0.8 means there's an 80% chance the order will be fulfilled.
proposals.target variable understanding: The 'is_fulfilled' variable is a binary classification target, indicating whether an order was successfully fulfilled (True) or not (False). The model will predict one of these two outcomes.

proposals.title: Sales Rep Performance Prediction
proposals.description: This use case aims to predict the total sales amount generated by each sales representative. A regression model will be trained to identify factors influencing individual sales rep performance using historical sales data. The model will use order attributes like product category, quantity, payment method, store location, and sales rep ID to predict the total sales amount for each sales rep. This will provide insights into sales rep performance, allowing for targeted training and resource allocation.
kpis: Sales prediction accuracy: How accurately the model predicts individual sales rep revenue.
Mean Absolute Error (MAE) of sales predictions: Average absolute difference between predicted and actual sales.
Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE) of sales predictions:  Measure of the standard deviation of the prediction errors.
Improved sales revenue per sales rep: Increase in average sales revenue per representative.
proposals.business_value: Predicting sales rep performance allows for better resource allocation, targeted training programs, and improved sales strategies. This will lead to increased overall sales revenue and improved business efficiency.
proposals.prediction_interpretation: The model will predict a numerical value representing the total sales amount expected from a given sales representative.  For example, a prediction of $15000 means the model expects the sales rep to generate $15000 in sales.
proposals.target variable understanding: The 'total_amount' variable is a continuous numerical variable representing the total revenue generated by an order. The model will predict a range of values corresponding to the total sales generated by a sales representative.

proposals.title: Payment Method Preference Prediction
proposals.description: This AI use case focuses on predicting the preferred payment method of customers. A classification model can be trained to identify patterns in customer choices based on order history. The model will use customer demographics and order details to predict the payment method a customer is most likely to choose. This helps businesses optimize their payment processing systems and potentially personalize customer experiences.
kpis: Accuracy of payment method prediction: Percentage of correctly predicted payment methods.
Precision of payment method prediction: Proportion of correctly predicted positive identifications.
Recall of payment method prediction: Proportion of actual positive cases correctly identified.
Improved payment processing efficiency: Reduction in payment processing time and costs.
proposals.business_value: By understanding customer payment preferences, businesses can optimize their payment systems and marketing campaigns. This will lead to improved customer satisfaction, reduced operational costs, and increased conversion rates.
proposals.prediction_interpretation: The model outputs the predicted payment method (e.g., 'Cash', 'Credit Card', 'PayPal', 'Bank Transfer').  For example, a prediction of 'Credit Card' indicates the model believes the customer will most likely use a credit card.
proposals.target variable understanding: The 'payment_method' variable is categorical, indicating the method used to pay for an order.  The model will predict one of the unique payment methods present in the dataset.

proposals.title: Product Category Sales Forecasting
proposals.description: This use case aims to forecast sales for different product categories. A regression model will be trained on historical sales data to predict future sales based on past trends and patterns.  The model will use variables such as order date, product category, and quantity sold to predict the total sales amount for each product category over a specified period. This allows businesses to anticipate demand, optimize inventory, and improve supply chain management.
kpis: Sales forecast accuracy: How precisely the model predicts future sales for each category.
Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE): Average percentage difference between predicted and actual sales.
Root Mean Squared Percentage Error (RMSPE): Measure of the standard deviation of the percentage prediction errors.
Inventory optimization: Improvement in inventory levels and reduced stockouts/overstocking.
proposals.business_value: Accurate sales forecasting leads to optimized inventory management, reduced storage costs, and avoidance of stockouts. This ultimately improves profitability and customer satisfaction.
proposals.prediction_interpretation: The model predicts a numerical value representing the expected total sales amount for a specific product category within a given time frame. For instance, a prediction of $5000 indicates an expected total sales amount of $5000 for that category.
proposals.target variable understanding: The 'total_amount' variable is a continuous numerical variable representing the total revenue generated by an order. The model will predict the sum of total amounts for each product category, allowing businesses to focus on categories showing higher potential.

proposals.title: Store Location Sales Analysis
proposals.description: This use case analyzes sales performance across different store locations. A regression model will be trained to predict total sales for each store location. The model will consider factors like order date, store location, and total amount to determine the sales for each location. This allows businesses to identify high-performing and underperforming stores, leading to better resource allocation and strategic decision-making.
kpis: Sales prediction accuracy by location:  Accuracy of the sales predictions for each individual store location.
Mean Absolute Error (MAE) of sales predictions by location: Average absolute difference between predicted and actual sales for each store location.
Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE) of sales predictions by location: Measure of the standard deviation of prediction errors for each store location.
Revenue increase in underperforming stores: Increase in sales for low performing stores after implementing strategies suggested by the model.
proposals.business_value: Analyzing sales by store location provides valuable insights for optimizing store operations, marketing strategies, and resource allocation.  This results in increased revenue and improved profitability for the entire business.
proposals.prediction_interpretation: The model predicts a numerical value representing the total sales amount expected for a specific store location over a given period.  A prediction of $20,000 for a particular store suggests the model forecasts $20,000 in sales for that location.
proposals.target variable understanding: The 'total_amount' variable is a continuous numerical variable representing the total revenue generated by an order. The model will predict a range of values corresponding to the total sales for each store location.
